topic.name: Human Geography & Cultural Anthropology
topic.description: 13-year academic progression (K-12) for Human Geography & Cultural Anthropology in History & Social Studies

objectives.objective_text: Identify foods from other countries (Pizza, Tacos).
Name words we use from other languages.
Identify the Columbian Exchange (food/animals).

objectives.sub_topic_name: Cultural Landscapes (Human imprint on the environment)
objectives.objective_text: Identify buildings and roads.

objectives.sub_topic_name: Cultural Landscapes (Human imprint on the environment)
objectives.objective_text: Name a bridge.

objectives.sub_topic_name: Cultural Landscapes (Human imprint on the environment)
objectives.objective_text: Identify landmarks.
Identify mom, dad, and kids.
Name grandmas and grandpas.
Identify family traditions.
Identify that people move to new houses.
Name 'Moving' as going to a new place.
Identify an immigrant.
Identify School, Church, and Home.
Name the Police and Government.
Identify how money works (Economy).
Identify a city and a farm.
Name a skyscraper.
Identify suburbs (places near cities).
Recall that we can learn from new friends.
Observe that ideas travel.

objectives.sub_topic_name: Cultural Landscapes (Human imprint on the environment)
objectives.objective_text: Recall that people change the land to live there.

objectives.sub_topic_name: Cultural Landscapes (Human imprint on the environment)
objectives.objective_text: Observe that we plant gardens.
Recall that families love each other.
Observe different sizes of families.
Recall that some places have many people (crowded).
Observe that people live where there is food and water.
Recall that rules help us live together.
Observe that we belong to groups.
Recall that food grows on farms, not in cities.
Observe traffic in the city.
Defend the biblical model of family as the foundational institution.
Summarize how trade spreads ideas.
Explain the Silk Road.
Explain 'Globalization'.
Defend the benefits of cultural exchange while preserving identity.

objectives.sub_topic_name: Cultural Landscapes (Human imprint on the environment)
objectives.objective_text: Summarize how people shape the land (terraced farming, dams).

objectives.sub_topic_name: Cultural Landscapes (Human imprint on the environment)
objectives.objective_text: Explain that buildings show what people believe (churches, temples).

objectives.sub_topic_name: Cultural Landscapes (Human imprint on the environment)
objectives.objective_text: Explain environmental modification (canals, land reclamation).
Summarize what an 'Extended Family' is.
Explain that in some places, grandparents live in the same house.
Explain Patriarchal vs. Matriarchal tendencies.
Summarize why people move (jobs, safety).
Explain 'Push Factors' (bad things making you leave) and 'Pull Factors' (good things calling you).
Explain the difference between immigration and emigration.
Defend the biblical mandate to welcome the stranger.
Summarize the five main institutions: Family, Religion, Education, Economy, Government.
Explain what schools do for society.
Explain 'Civil Society' (clubs, charities).
Defend the necessity of strong institutions for liberty.
Summarize the shift from farms to factories.
Explain why cities are growing bigger.
Explain 'Urban Sprawl'.
Defend the importance of the rural agrarian economy.
Compare local customs with global trends.
Analyze the spread of religion (missionaries/conquest).
Interpret the impact of the internet on culture.
Connect colonization to language spread (English/Spanish).

objectives.sub_topic_name: Cultural Landscapes (Human imprint on the environment)
objectives.objective_text: Compare a natural landscape with a built landscape.

objectives.sub_topic_name: Cultural Landscapes (Human imprint on the environment)
objectives.objective_text: Interpret the 'sense of place' created by human activity.

objectives.sub_topic_name: Cultural Landscapes (Human imprint on the environment)
objectives.objective_text: Connect religious beliefs to burial practices and cemeteries.

objectives.sub_topic_name: Cultural Landscapes (Human imprint on the environment)
objectives.objective_text: Defend the stewardship of cultural heritage sites.
Compare a nuclear family with a tribe.
Interpret the biblical genealogies as kinship records.
Connect family structure to social stability.
Compare a city with a farm area.
Analyze the Demographic Transition Model.
Interpret population pyramids.
Connect war and famine to refugee crises.
Compare the role of the Church with the role of the Government.
Analyze the function of institutions in maintaining order.
Interpret how institutions pass on values.
Connect the breakdown of the family to crime.
Compare the noise of the city with the quiet of the country.
Analyze the problems of rapid urbanization (slums, infrastructure).
Interpret the reasons for the decline of rural populations.
Connect the Industrial Revolution to the rise of cities.
Analyze the role of the clan in ancient societies.
Evaluate the homogenization of culture vs. local resistance.

objectives.sub_topic_name: Cultural Landscapes (Human imprint on the environment)
objectives.objective_text: Evaluate the aesthetic and ethical impact of urban design.
Evaluate the breakdown of the nuclear family in the West.
Evaluate the economic impact of migration.
Evaluate the state's encroachment on the family and church.
Evaluate the cultural divide between rural and urban voters.
Construct a map of a cultural trait's diffusion (e.g., Buddhism or Blue Jeans).
Synthesize the mechanisms of diffusion (Contagious, Hierarchical, Relocation).

objectives.sub_topic_name: Cultural Landscapes (Human imprint on the environment)
objectives.objective_text: Analyze how culture affects architecture.

objectives.sub_topic_name: Cultural Landscapes (Human imprint on the environment)
objectives.objective_text: Construct an analysis of 'Sequent Occupance' in a specific region.

objectives.sub_topic_name: Cultural Landscapes (Human imprint on the environment)
objectives.objective_text: Synthesize the interaction between physical geography and cultural expression.
Construct a comparison of Individualist vs. Collectivist family dynamics.
Synthesize the sociological data on family structure and child outcomes.
Construct a demographic profile of an aging nation (e.g., Japan).
Synthesize population trends with future geopolitical power.
Construct a theory of 'Sphere Sovereignty' (Abraham Kuyper).
Synthesize the interplay between religious belief and economic systems (Weber).
Construct a model of sustainable urban planning.
Synthesize the future of the 'Megacity' in the developing world.
